resources.string: No trips found. Has this card been used?

No part of this card is freely readable without a key and currently this format has no practical vulnerabilities.

 Your card is not supported by Metrodroid and it is unlikely it will ever be, unless the key for it is deciphered.

 Please lobby the card issuer to allow open data access on issued cards. It is safe to permit open, read-only access to data with modern smartcard technology. Some agencies even provide open documentation about the data format!

No part of this card is freely readable without a key. You have no valid keys installed for it. 
 
The card will work once keys are installed for it. These are generally different for each card. More info about acquiring and installing keys can be found in the documentation. 
 
Please lobby the card issuer to allow open data access on issued cards. It is safe to permit open, read-only access to data with modern smartcard technology. Some agencies even provide open documentation about the data format!
Please enable NFC to read card info.
This card is not yet supported by Metrodroid. Only raw data can be displayed.
Tap for more info on Metrodroid support for this card.
Metrodroid and its authors are not associated with any public transit agency.
You have not scanned any cards.
Encryption keys are required to read this card.
Encryption keys for this card are loaded.
Metrodroid does not support keys for this type of card.
The key file "%1$s" (containing %2$s) will be gone forever.
For safety reasons, you can\'t delete keys while card number obfuscation is enabled. Turn it off if you want to delete keys.
Save a binary dump of your keys as a file with a .farebotkeys extension, e-mail it as an attachment to yourself, and then open it on this device.
This card is not supported by your device.
Use a custom tile server for embedded maps, using Leaflet TileLayer syntax.
If using {s} in map URLs, a comma separated list of subdomains, or single-character list of subdomains.
For help on using map tile URLs, see Leaflet\'s online documentation (only available in English).
Number of times to attempt authentication for each sector
Some agencies have no identifying magic on their card. To read them, you must select an agency explicitly.
Cards which cannot be read by this device will have a red ‘not supported’ warning displayed over its artwork
Unsupported cards will not have anything covering their artwork
Change the balance shown by a random amount
Show trip, subscription, expiry and scan dates as different, random days
Fuzz and reduce resolution of timestamps on trips, subscriptions, and scans
Change fares shown by a random amount
When you scan a card, the balance will be automatically read aloud. This works even when a screen reader is not running.
Add language hints to place names
Adds language hints (LocaleSpan) to place names, such as station, stop, line and route names. This alters the pronunciation used by screen readers and other accessibility software.

Text-to-speech voices normally only work well for one language.

LocaleSpan hints are used to mark text as being in a different language. When applied to a station, stop, line or route name, a screen reader that supports these hints will pronounce the name using synthesized voices from the place's native language, rather than the language you have configured Android to use.

Enabling this option generally improves the pronunciation of foreign place names that are not internationally renowned, but you might find it more difficult to understand.

This does not normally change the on-screen display of place names, but some devices may use a different font.

This requires accessibility software that supports the LocaleSpan API (such as Google TalkBack), and that you have appropriate voices installed.
Change the application language. Needs application restart to apply
Trying alternate user-supplied keys for sector %d…

The card went out of range while reading.

 Some data was read, but it might not be enough to get useful data.

 Thick cases and metal can interfere with NFC operation. Failure could also indicate that the card or your device's NFC antenna is damaged.
Show both local and English station names
Shows both local and English names regardless of locale, using the most appropriate variant when off.
Supports both plastic (reloadable) and paper (single-use cards issued by Golden Gate Ferry and Muni) Clipper cards.
Both old (green) and new (blue) cards are supported. Both reloadable and single-use are supported.
Transfer (from other ferry to Manly Ferry)
Transfer (from other mode to Manly Ferry)
Free travel passes and single trip tickets are not supported.
Only serial, trips and subscriptions can be read
Only the card number can be read.
Optional Additional Season Ticket, First Class
Trip times will be shown in the transit agency\'s local time zone.
Trip times will be converted to your current time zone.
This Troika is not properly formatted. It needs to be topped up at ticket counter before it can be used.
This card appears to be blank. It is formatted, but without any data written to it other than a serial number by which it can be uniquely identified and linked to a database.
Korea Financial Telecommunications and Clearings Institute
Station and route IDs are shown in addition to their names
Station and route IDs are hidden unless unknown
Use of station databases, obfuscation modes…
Fallback reader for MIFARE Classic, physical card interface settings…
Metrodroid will read all systems on FeliCa cards. This is the default.
Metrodroid will read only the first system on FeliCa cards. This simulates a workaround for a bug in iOS. Reads of multi-system FeliCa cards will be incomplete!

Shares your card details with Transport for Ireland, in order to respond to the Leap card\'s authentication challenge. TFI will know you used Metrodroid on this card. The card can not be read without this key.
This card was not unlocked. Please turn on “Retrieve keys for Leap cards” in the NFC preferences.
Requires retrieving keys from TFI, which must be turned on in the NFC preferences.
Only first generation (MIFARE Classic) cards are supported. Current generation cards (which have a "D" printed on the bottom left corner) are fully locked DESFire cards, and thus unsupportable.
Metro line CP - Rio de Mouro/Meleças
Fertagus Palmela to Lisbon + Metropolitan Area
Static keys cannot be assigned to a single card.
Only pre-2016 cards. Only trip log can be read.
This card only contains a serial number. Its balance and history are only stored in a central database.
This card is locked, and only the serial number can be read. Its balance and history might be stored on it, but are not accessible.
Support for this card is in development, and currently only the serial number can be read.
200: 100%% for municipal, 0%% for railroad, 0%% for water transport
100: 50%% for municipal, 0%% for railroad, 0%% for water transport
111: 50%% for municipal, 50%% for railroad, 50%% for water transport
Only pre-2016 (MIFARE Classic) cards can be read. Newer fully locked DESFire cards are unsupportable.
How much raw info to show in parsed data. Not all parsers support this option
App to show balance on transit cards

This tag is currently unsupported by Metrodroid.

 Supported technologies:

Show debug colour for locale spans
Highlight default language in green, English in yellow and local language in blue
The file you have chosen is large (%s) and may crash the app. Do you want to proceed?
Identifies the card(s) in a Metrodroid file
Converts Metrodroid XML/JSON into latest version of JSON
Parses the card(s) in a Metrodroid file
Lists unrecognized card(s) in a Metrodroid file
Lists all cards supported by Metrodroid
Communicates with a card using the PC/SC API
Print the hardware info of card(s)
Print cards with valid MiFare Classic Access Directory and its content
